result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel J Watt

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court file in court for sentencing on the defendant's other pending matters. Court took no action in this case. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Nathaniel J Watt in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Defendant Nathaniel J Watt in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Negtiations placed on the recod. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing in case #14CF5603 and #15CF255.  Calendar call scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Nathaniel J Watt not in court, defendant in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin .Attorney Kurzynski requested on 7/17/15 that this case be rescheduled due to a conflict with his trial.  Attorney Pucek did not object.  Case is rescheduled for projected guilty plea before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski appeared by telephone, defendant Nathaniel J Watt not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared by e-mail for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial and Attorney Kurzynski is unavailable.  Case is adjourned for projected guilty plea before Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski in court, defendant Nathaniel J Watt not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Entry made without file. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Same bail.

Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Case is adjourned for plea before Branch 20.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Inge S.; Pamela C. or William K.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Nathaniel J Watt in court with attorney Thomas W. Kurzynski.  Defendant Nathaniel J Watt in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case, this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference June 1, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 20.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain a DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
